name: Hugh Masekela
description: '''Hugh Ramapolo Masekela''' (4 April 1939 â€“ 23 January 2018) was a South African trumpeter, [[flugelhorn]]ist, [[cornet]]ist, singer and composer who was described as "the father of [[South African jazz]]". Masekela was known for his jazz compositions and for writing well-known [[Music in the movement against apartheid|anti-apartheid songs]] such as "[[Soweto Blues]]" and "[[Bring Him Back Home (Nelson Mandela)|Bring Him Back Home]]". He also had a [[List of Billboard Hot 100 number-one singles of 1968|number-one US pop hit in 1968]] with his version of "[[Grazing in the Grass]]".
